p: The 80% hydro-methanolic crude root extract of B. antidysenterica showed a significant reduction in both average weight and volume of intestinal contents as compared with the negative control. Significant inhibition of intestinal milked volume was recorded on 200 mg/kg ( p < 0.05) and 400 mg/kg ( p < 0.01) test dose relative to the negative control group. The highest dose of test extract 400 mg/kg showed comparable result (37.76%, p < 0.01) as of standard drug Loperamide 3 mg/kg (39.80%, p < 0.01) (Table 3).
